name: Hope For Centuries (CD)
description:
Physical CD

"Poignant songs of love, betrayal and more finds Parsons at the top of his game."

***************

Label: Meer Music 
Catalog Number: MM001
Release Date: June 10, 2011
Distributed by: India Media Group / Rough Trade
LC 24951
EAN Number: 0738435229221

© & ℗ 2011 Joseph Parsons / Meer Music

01 Harbinger 		4:53
02 Runway		4:08
03 Cruel Hard World	3:18
04 More			3:47
05 Roman & Michael	4:58
06 Color Of Love	3:44
07 Float			2:53
08 Never Know		4:20
09 Design For Life	2:16
10 Broken Vows	3:08
11 Spiritual		4:35
12 The Meditation	4:29
13 SingSingSing	3:50

Produced & Mixed by Devin Greenwood

Joseph Parsons	        Vocals, Acoustic Guitars
Freddi Lubitz		Bass, Background Vocals
Ross Bellenoit		Electric Guitars, Moog, Baritone Guitar
Sven Hansen		Drums & Percussion

Devin Greenwood	Organ, Background Vocals, Percussion, Piano, Electric Guitar, Glockenspiel, Harmonica
Emily Ana Zeitlyn	Background Vocals

Recording Engineer Matt Muir
Recorded at Kawari Sound in Wyncote, Pennsylvania USA
Mixed at the Honey Jar in Brooklyn, NYC
Mastered by Andy Horn at the Red Room in Berolzheim, Germany

Design by Anna (aodesign.de)
Photo Credits: Christian Schirbort, Anna Parsons, Lisa Schafer (skylerbug.com), Freddi Lubitz, Jörg Lindnör, Joseph Parsons

All Songs written by Joseph Parsons (©2011 Joseph Parsons / ThenThen Music)
Except ‘Broken Vows’ - Lyrics author unknown, translated from an old Irish poem by Lady Gregory 1852-1932)

All songs Arranged by the Joseph Parsons Band
All songs Published by ThenThen Music / All Rights Reserved.

Meer-Music.com

Special thanks to Anna, Jim-Elias & Samuel, Devin Greenwood, Matt Muir, Karl & Frederick Rieders, Lisa Schaffer, Christian Schirbort, Wolfgang Hess, Christian ‘Boomer’ Böhm - Böhm Booking, Jürgen Stahl - Stahl Entertainment, Peter & Else Obereigner, Sean & Lisa Timmons, Edgar Heckmann, Jan Janssen, Ward & Jenny Parsons, Terry Lee Hale, Andy Horn, Bet Williams & John Hodian, Elliott & Françoise Murphy • Sven would like to thank Ilka Böhm, family and friends; Frank Rohe and Birgit Helfrich (M&T), Bernd Neubauer (Beyerdynamic), Paul Agner (Agner drumsticks) Sven plays Mapex drums, Sabian cymbals, Aquarian drumheads, Agner Drumsticks and uses Beyerdynamic microphones • Freddi would like to thank Lisa, my family, Matthijs Tempels, Sibi Siebert at Box of Trix, Trinix Studio Arnhem. Freddi uses EBS Amps & Cabinets and D.D. Cases • Ross would like to thank Hanson Guitars, MI Audio, Keeley Electronics, and (of course) his family and friends.

Please visit josephparsons.com for more information.


www.josephparsons.com

Meer Music
Ebereschenweg 6, 31535 Neustadt
www.meer-music.com



I’ve been playing music with Sven, Freddi & Ross for a few years now and enjoying every show we play.  We have never made a studio record together before and this CD is our first foray into that world.  And it was a dream to make!  We arrived in Philadelphia in late November 2010 and made this record in a week of playing & recording these songs together - live!  This is the first record I’ve made this way.  Usually, we cut the rhythm tracks and then overdub the vocals & guitars or vise-a-versa.  Devin and I agreed that to capture this band with the most vibe, we needed to be all together during the entire process.  Wow, very cool indeed.

I wrote these songs over the last couple of years starting when I was recording the ‘Heavens Above’ CD.  Some of these songs were written while living in Paris at Elliott Murphy’s apartment and some were written at my friend Wolfgang Hess’ house in northern Germany.  He offered me a remote ‘cabin’ in January.  Perfect!

I am happy that you hold this CD in your hand and we hope you enjoy the music and spread the word about us.  

Please come to see a live show if you can, they are very cool events!

Peace,

Joseph
Hannover, Germany
March 5, 2011

name: Slaughterhouse Live (DDP)
description:
©2009 Joseph Parsons

Joseph Parsons Band
Slaughterhouse Live (Double CD)
Release Date: October 23, 2009

21 Songs - All live with no overdubs. 
Recorded at the Altes Schlachthaus (Old Slaughterhouse) in Schwäbisch Hall, Germany 

From the label: 
"This is the first Live CD from Joseph Parsons in 10 years.  It is the best live recording of Joseph to date.  Joseph says; "This was recorded during a fantastic tour of Europe in Autumn 2008, and I am thrilled to have captured it in this recording.  I hope you feel the vibe that we felt that night!"  And that's what this recording has, vibe. The spirit of the evening, the raw emotion and the power of the band allows for these dynamic songs to shine.  Some of the standout tracks include the new 'Myriad Of Things', 'Shine' and a soulful version of Marvin Gaye's 'What's Going On'.

'The band is Joseph Parsons (vocals, acoustic & electric guitars), Ross Bellenoit (electric guitar, lap steel & vocals), Sven Hansen (drums) & Freddi Lubitz (bass, vocals)."

--

Technical info:
These are High Definition tracks, the original master tracks that made the CD.

Included in this DDP (Digital Download Package):
- .WAV Files - CD Quality
- .MP3 Files - Hi Res
- Original Printable Artwork
- 1.2 gb Zip File

You can import into your digital music program (ie. iTunes) or use a burning software to make a normal CD.

I suggest you back it up as it is yours forever. There are no restrictions on it and I encourage you to share it. Music is meant to be listened to.  

I also encourage you to listen to this with headphones. 

*****
Joseph Parsons Band

Songs:
CD 1
1. Sun Gonna Shine
2. King Of Baltimore
3. Taken By Surprise
4. Sky Boys
5. Shades Of Gray					
6. Children In the Sun
7. Tell Me Hello
8. Sitting On Top Of The World
9. Heavens Above
10. Myriad Of Things

CD 2
1. Good Or Bad (solo)
2. First Sight (solo)
3. Dume Room	
4. Shine
5. Skipping Stone		
6. Crocodile
7. Memories			
8. Another Way Around
9. Falling
10. What's Going On
11. No Disguise

All Songs Copyright Joseph Parsons/ThenThen Music/BMI
Sub-Published by FutureWorld Consulting & Publishing (GAS Only)
Except: 
Sitting On Top Of The World
© 2008 Joseph Parsons/ThenThen Music/BMI & Elliott Murphy/SACEM
'What's Going On' (Marvin Gaye)

Joseph Parsons	Vocals, Acoustic & Electric Guitars
Ross Bellenoit	Electric Guitar, Lap Steel, Vocals
Freddi Lubitz	Bass, Vocals
Sven Hansen	Drums

Tour Manager Christian (Cap'n Boomer) Böhm
Recorded by Andy Horn on October 22, 2008 at the Altes Schlachthaus (Old Slaughterhouse) in Schwabish Hall, Germany
Mixed and Mastered by Andy Horn at the "Red Room", Germany
Executive Producer Edgar Heckmann, Blue Rose Records

Design by Anna at AO Design (www.aodesign.de)

name: Falling (CD)
description:
Physical CD

For many years I had wanted to make a solo recording of songs as close to the way they were written as possible. Sometimes the songs weren't arranged 'correctly', sometimes I played wrong chords, sang different words or even different melodies.  But these are the things that give each song their own identity and authenticity. This recording is made that way.  No overdubs, single takes & raw.

Peace,

joseph

name: Falling (DDP)
description:
©2008 Joseph Parsons

10 raw songs recorded solo Vocal, Acoustic Guitar and Piano. Honest songs with no overdubs. "Sunday morning music" say's Joseph. Includes beautiful and intimate versions of Shy, Dume Room, Falling, Sun Gonna Shine, several unreleased songs and more. 

A Digital Download Package (.zip File 416mb) with everything: CD Quality .WAV files, MP3's and Original Printable Artwork. • Import into digital music applications (PC or MAC, iTunes etc), burn original CDR's or share with friends! name: US RAILS • Wire & Wood (CD)
description:
WIRE & WOOD, a special acoustic record by US Rails

Recorded over a leisurely two day stay at Kawari Studios in Wyncote, PA during The US Rails 2012 East Coast Tour of America. Much frivolity ensued, everyone sang....and drinks were had!!!

01. Do What You Love
02. Nightbird
03. Same Old You
04. The Spell
05. Don't Take Me Now
06. Lucky Stars
07. Man Down
08. Brown Me In The Sun
09. Old Song On The Radio
10. Prelude: Heart Don't Lie
11. Heart Don't Lie 

All Songs © Ⓟ 2012 US Rails. All Rights Reserved.

name: HARDPAN • LIVE (DDP)
description:
©2003 Hardpan

This was made in 2002 from a show on the one tour ever made. It was a fun and memorable tour for sure. The live show was an interesting act of moving between instruments all night long. Sound was never great so we really had to rely on the fans and fun of the evening. Tequila helped a lot. Sometimes it helped a little too much. 

This DDP does NOT have the video. The video is available on YouTube at this point. If it is not, we will put it up. But this DDP DOES have some extra, very cool photo's from the recording sessions in Tucson, Arizona at Chris's place.

This DDP (1.2gb) Includes:
- WAV Files (CD Quality)
- MP3 Files (Hi-Res)
- Original Printable Artwork in PDF & JPG Format
- Extra Photo's from the recording sessions and studio.
- Tour Poster Printable Artwork

name: 4 WAY STREET • Pretzel Park
description:
This was a band the preceded US Rails from 2000-2003. Ben Arnold, Jim Boggia, Scott Bricklin, Matt Muir & myself, Joseph Parsons.  We had a great run in the Northeast USA for a few years and some very memorable shows!  This was our only studio CD. It was originally released on Sanctuary Records and then they dropped us as soon as it came out. And then they too disappeared...

*****

This DDP (Digital Download Package) includes:
• Original .WAV files (CD quality)
• MP3 Files (192 bit)
• Original Printable Artwork with Lyrics (PDF)
• Many Extra Photo's!
• 645MB .zip File

Import into digital music applications (PC or MAC, iTunes etc), burn original CDR's or share with friends! 

YES, we do think music should be shared. It also should be bought by those who appreciate it and/or can afford it.
